arm_group.description: HIV infected patients older than 50 years in current follow up

brief_summary.textblock:
Prospective cohort study to determine the prevalence of vertebral fractures in HIV infected
      patients older than 50 years.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevalence of Vertebral Fractures in HIV Infected Patients Older Than 50 Years

detailed_description.textblock:
To determine the prevalence of asymptomatic vertebral fractures in HIV patients older than
      50 years, and the risk of fracture during a follow up of 2 years, according to bone mineral
      density at inclusion, the  level of serum bone biomarkers, and the presence of secondary
      factors such as hypovitaminosis D or/and secondary hyperparathyroidism.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Age above 50 years

          -  HIV infection

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Pregnancy

          -  Receiving corticosteroids or antiresorptive therapy

study_pop.textblock: HIV infected patients older than 50 years

clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence of Vertebral Fractures in HIV Infected Patients Older Than 50 Years: Importance of Bone Mineral Density and Bone Biomarkers

primary_outcome.description: To determine by lumbar and thoracic x ray the presence of vertebral fractures and the changes in vertebral form or size, according to Genant methods
primary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of vertebral fractures in HIV patients older than 50 years

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Fundacion para la Investigacion Biomedica del Hospital Universitario Ramon y Cajal
responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Itziar de Pablo López de Abechuco

secondary_outcome.description: To determine the relationships of vertebral alterations with bone mineral density by dual X-ray absorptiometry
secondary_outcome.measure: Risk of vertebral alteration according to bone mineral density and serum biomarkers

secondary_outcome.description: To determine the emergence of vertebral alterations during 2 years of follow up according to bone mineral density, bone biomarkers (osteocalcin, beta-crosslaps), and vitamin D/parathyroid hormone (PTH) status.

clinical_study.source: Fundacion para la Investigacion Biomedica del Hospital Universitario Ramon y Cajal

lead_sponsor.agency: Itziar de Pablo López de Abechuco

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
